result.execSummary:
The defendant Joyce R Chaney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8-27-2016 or, if not paid, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. STAYED until 9/3/15.
Court has no objection to ES. Defendant to serve 6 months in the Day Reporting Center.
*9/21/2015  Release privileges for work and childcare granted.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joyce R Chaney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Court signed order granting defendant's request for release privileges for work and child care. Copies sent to the parties. lr
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. John Siefert, Br. 47, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se request for Huber privileges.

Defendant Joyce R Chaney in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months  in the Day Reporting Center , consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0  days time served.  Court has no objection to ES. Court stayed the commencment until 9-3-15. 

Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 8-27-2016  or, if not paid, civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant. 

Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Defendant Joyce R Chaney in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case heard off the record. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed. Defense attorney in trial in another court and requests an adjourned Sentencing date. Case adjourned to 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joyce R Chaney in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. 

AS TO COUNT 2
Defendant waived rights and pled guilty.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire, Addendum, and Elements received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered.

Case adjourned for Sentencing in branch 47.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joyce R Chaney in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjourned Plea and Sentencing Hearing. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joyce R Chaney in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Case set for Status Conference. Defense requests a Plea and Sentencing date. Court granted defense request. Case adjourned to branch 47.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joyce R Chaney in court with attorney Richard E. Thomey.  Katherine Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 47. lr  Status conference scheduled for 05-08-2015 at 08:30 am.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Smart located at 3201 N. Mayfair Road, in the City of Wauwatosa, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

Defendant Joyce R Chaney in court.  Kurt Brian Benkley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.   Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance.  Defendant IS Public Defender eligible.  Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  The case is adjourned to Br. 47 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Joyce R Chaney
Current: 5152 N. Sherman Blvd., Milwaukee, WI 53209   (Effective: 02-12-2015)
Prior: 5663 W Thurston Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
